intro: Romulea variicolor var. variicolor, commonly known as the varicolored romulea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that range from yellow to orange and red. The plant produces tuberous roots and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically blooms in spring and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant and unique floral display.
